page.title: 01Capenhurst
page.content: Situated to the north of Chester & the west of Ellesmere Port,the area is Permo Trias,low lying & mantled with boulder clay & alluvium.It has less than 40 inches of rain a year & mild sea air gives 7 frost free months per year.It is mostly designated as Green Belt & is predominantly used for dairy farming.However,the western section, bounded by the A41 & A5117 will, with the completion of estates near their junction be almost totally covered by housing.The Chester to Merseyside railway bisects the area & a newly opened extension of the M56 motorway starts in the south of the area linking it to the nations system.The most significant feature of the area is the British Nuclear Fuels uranium enrichment plant although its distinctive cooling towers are being demolished.
